PHD526.name: Molecular Biology and Medical Genetics
PHD526.description: Basic principles of human medical genetics; storage and expression of genetic information; transmission of genetic information to progeny.
PHD526.restrictions: Open only to students in the College of Human Medicine or the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

PHD591.name: Special Problems in Human Development
PHD591.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD591.description: Work under the direction of a faculty member on an experimental, theoretical, or applied problem.
PHD591.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in the colleges of Human and Osteopathic Medicine.

PHD600.name: Pediatric Specialty Clerkship
PHD600.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD600.description: Multidisciplinary approach to children and their families in a health care setting. Integrated biological, behavioral, and clinical sciences in assessing and planning children's health care needs.
PHD600.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in College of Human Medicine.

PHD601.name: Human Development and Pediatric Sub-specialties
PHD601.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD601.description: Experience in clinical, behavioral, and basic sciences related to pediatrics and human development.
PHD601.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD602.name: Ambulatory Pediatric Clerkship
PHD602.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD602.description: Clinical experience in outpatient and community setting involving ongoing child health care.
PHD602.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD603.name: Pediatric Infectious Diseases Clerkship
PHD603.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD603.description: Office, clinic, and inpatient experiences in evaluating and managing pediatric patients with infectious diseases. Interpretation and use of clinical laboratory data.
PHD603.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD604.name: Neonatology
PHD604.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD604.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in College of Human Medicine.

PHD605.name: Pediatric Cardiology Clerkship
PHD605.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD605.description: Office, clinic, and hospital experience in diagnostic and therapeutic pediatric cardiology including special diagnostic procedures.
PHD605.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD606.name: Pediatric Endocrinology and Metabolism Clerkship
PHD606.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD606.description: Clinic and hospital experience in evaluating pediatric patients with endocrine and metabolic disorders.
PHD606.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD607.name: Pediatric Hematology and Oncology Clerkship
PHD607.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD607.description: Clinical experience in evaluating and managing pediatric patients with common hematologic and oncologic disorders.
PHD607.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD608.name: Pediatric Pulmonary Disease Clerkship
PHD608.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD608.description: Inpatient and outpatient clinical experiences in evaluating and managing pediatric patients with pulmonary disease. Diagnostic procedures, pathobiology of pulmonary system, current research.
PHD608.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD609.name: Pediatric Genetics Clerkship
PHD609.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD609.description: Prenatal and developmental history taking. Identification of genetically determine conditions and major and minor anomalies. Use of genetic databases. Family counseling. Selection and interpretation of genetic tests.
PHD609.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD610.name: Pediatric Allergy-Immunology Clerkship
PHD610.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD610.description: Pathophysiology and evaluation of various atopic and immunologic disorders in pediatric patients.
PHD610.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD611.name: Pediatric Critical Care Medicine Clerkship
PHD611.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD611.description: Clinical experience in pediatric critical care medicine including respiratory, acid/base, infectious disease etiologies.
PHD611.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD612.name: Pediatric Gastroenterology Clerkship
PHD612.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD612.description: Clinical experience in the outpatient and inpatient evaluation and management of pediatric gastrointestinal disease.
PHD612.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD613.name: Pediatric Emergency Medicine Clerkship
PHD613.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD613.description: Assessment and management of pediatric patients in the emergency care setting.
PHD613.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD614.name: Pediatric Nephrology Clerkship
PHD614.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD614.description: Clinical experience in the outpatient and inpatient settings in assessment and management of children with renal disease.
PHD614.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD615.name: Pediatric Neurology Clerkship
PHD615.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD615.description: Clinical care of children with neurological disease in inpatient and outpatient settings.
PHD615.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD616.name: Pediatric Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation Clerkship
PHD616.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD616.description: Clinical experience working with children with acute and chronic disabilities
PHD616.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD617.name: Pediatric Adolescent Medicine Clerkship
PHD617.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD617.description: Clinical experience and psychosocial dimensions of adolescent medical care in inpatient or outpatient settings.
PHD617.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD618.name: Pediatrics Sub-Internship
PHD618.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD618.description: Clinical experience in which students take primary responsibility for managing the care of pediatric patients under the supervision of senior residents and/or attending physicians.
PHD618.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD619.name: Pediatric Hospital Medicine Clerkship
PHD619.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD619.description: Clinical experience in pediatric medicine in the inpatient setting. Common and uncommon conditions.
PHD619.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD620.name: Child Abuse Pediatric Clerkship
PHD620.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD620.description: Clinical assessment and care of children at risk for violence, abuse or neglect in outpatient or inpatient settings.
PHD620.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD621.name: Pediatric Rheumatology Clerkship
PHD621.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD621.description: Pathophysiology and evaluation of pediatric rheumatology patients. Multidisciplinary care of children with chronic rheumatologic diseases.
PHD621.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD633.name: Extended Clinical Experience
PHD633.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD633.description: Interviewing skills, history, physical exam, problem solving and therapy in community hospitals and ambulatory sites.

PHD641.name: Pediatric Clerkship in the Late Clinical Experience
PHD641.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD641.description: Clinical experience in which students take primary responsibility for managing the care of pediatric patients under the supervision of senior residents and/or attending physicians.
PHD641.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD643.name: Pediatric Critical Care
PHD643.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD643.description: Hospital-based clinical experience in evaluating and managing acutely ill pediatric patients.
PHD643.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD644.name: Pediatric Clerkship in the Late Clinical Experience Remediation
PHD644.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD644.description: Interviewing skills, history, physical exam, problem solving and therapy based in community hospitals and/or ambulatory sites.
PHD644.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

PHD645.name: Pediatric Critical Care Remediation
PHD645.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PHD645.description: Hospital-based clinical experience in evaluating and managing acutely ill pediatric patients.
PHD645.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.
